Gandhi is a 1997 Indian biographical drama film directed by Richard Attenborough. The movie follows Mahatma Gandhi as he leads the Indian independence movement against British rule through nonviolent civil disobedience.
Schindler's List is a 1993 American historical drama film directed by Steven Spielberg. The movie is based on the novel of the same name by Thomas Keneally. The film tells the story of Oskar Schindler, a German businessman who saved the lives of more than a thousand Jewish refugees during the Holocaust.
Seven is a 2007 American psychological thriller film directed by David Fincher. The movie follows an autistic man who uses his powers of observation and memory to solve seven murders that are eerily similar to the seven deadly sins.
Fargo is a 1996 American crime film directed by Ethan Coen and Joel Coen. The movie is a crime comedy-drama set in Minnesota during the 1930s. The story follows a rabbi who hires two criminals to help him kidnap his wife and collect the ransom.

(C) Dances with Wolves is only similar to The Shawshank Redemption in that it is also an emotional drama set during the closing days of the American frontier.
